posts.message:

posts.message:
اللقاء التاسع و العشرون من راديو اسأل مطور, في هذا الأسبوع يقدم لنا المهندس محمد تيسير عرض عن الWeb Front End Optimization و كيف تستفيد من الطرق المختلفة لتحسين أداء موقعك.
يستعرض الموضوع العديد من الأساليب الشهيرة و أمثلة لتطبيقها مثل الGziping و Caching و ضغط الصور و العديد من المشاكل التي قد تواجهك.
http://www.askdeveloper.com/2013/10/ask-developer-hangout-29-web-front-end.html

Mohamed Tayseer is the founder & CEO of www.rawa7.com a free online service that helps public transit commuter in Egypt.

Find our guest on the social networks
Twitter: @m_tayseer

للمزيد من التفاصيل يمكنك متابعة صفحتنا على فيسبوك
http://facebook.com/askdeveloper

أو متابعة موقعنا
http://www.askdeveloper.com
posts.description: Ask Developer Hangout - 29 - Web Front-End Optimization with Mohamed Tayseer

posts.message:
The recording is from Brisbane but they had the same session in Sydney first and it was one of the best offline sessions I have attended ever.

Will get you introduced to Functional Programming in C#, Higher Order Functions, Monads, and much more.

BTW, if you don't know already, Joe Albahari is the creator of Linqpad.

posts.caption: getfirebug.com
posts.description: Firebug extensions augment or otherwise enhance the Firebug extension. Firebug extensions typically come in the form of Firefox add-ons.

posts.caption: www.pontikis.net
posts.description: Remove unused style rules to speed-up browser rendering. Use Dust-Me Selectors on Firefox, Audit tools on Chrome or tools as gtmetrix.com or unused-css.com

posts.message:
Yesterday we were talking about image compression for front-end optimization. Today I found this study by Mozilla for better alternatives for JPG

http://people.mozilla.org/~josh/lossy_compressed_image_study_october_2013/
posts.caption: people.mozilla.org
posts.description: This study compares the compression performance of four different image formats: JPEG, JPEG XR, WebP, and HEVC-MSP. The latter three formats were chosen because they are frequently discussed as possible JPEG successors.
